etymology.description: Original glyphs ⿱㚔廾 and ⿱㚔𠬜 depict 㚔 (handcuff) + 廾/𠬜 (pair of hands) -> hand positioning denoted 'to release' -> Eastern Zhou added 目 (eye) for 'to pick with eyes' -> modern form 目 (eye) + 㚔 (handcuff)
etymology.interpretation: The character 睪 underwent a transformation from denoting actions related to holding and releasing, eventually including the element 目 (eye) to emphasize the act of picking visually, reflecting its usage in assessing or selecting.

examples.chinese: 他举起手臂(他舉起手臂)，露出略带汗渍的睪(睪)。
examples.pinyin: Tā jǔ qǐ shǒubì, lùchū lüè dài hànzì de yì.
examples.english: He raised his arm, revealing his slightly sweaty armpit.

examples.chinese: 他深吸一口气(他深吸一口氣)，准备睪所有的烦恼(準備睪所有的煩惱)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shēn xī yī kǒuqì, zhǔnbèi yì suǒyǒu de fánnào.
examples.english: He took a deep breath, ready to release all his troubles.
